page.title: 03ST. MARY'S CHURCH, WHITTON
page.content: Services held every 2nd.and 4th Sunday in the Month.This year the Community Services have replaced a steep muddy bank with concrete and brick steps leading up to this lovely Church.The Church yard is surrounded by a wooden fence and shrubs.The Church yard looks a little untidy,but this is because of the abundance of wild flowers and daffodils which are allowed to flower and seed before being cut.The kissing wicket at the top entry to the Church was stolen in February this year and never found,so a new one was bought.The Quota contribution for St. Marys is Â£410.There is an average congregation of 5.During the past year there have been 2 Christenings,3 Funerals and the last wedding was 4 years ago.Heating is provided by an oil boiler.Tony Mantle is the local grave digger and the charge is Â£30.
